7. Using Modules

In this unit, you externalize the Application Header in a module.

Step 1: Create the Header Module

  1. Create a new file named Header.js in the js directory.

  2. Move the let Header = React.createClass function from app.js into Header.js.

  3. Replace the let Header = variable definition with export default. The code in Header.js should look like this:

    export default React.createClass({ // ES6: new object literals notation (function)
    render() {
        return (<header>
            <h1>{this.props.title}</h1>
        </header>);
    }
});

  4. Add the following import statement at the top of the file to import React:

    import React from 'react';

Step 2: Use the Header Module

  1. In app.js make sure you removed the let Header = React.createClass function

  2. Add an import statement at the top of the file to import the newly created Header module: 

    import Header from './Header';

Step 3: Build and Run

  1. On the command line, type the following command to rebuild the application:

    npm run webpack

  2. Open a browser, access http://localhost:8080, and click the Calculate button.

Additional Resources

  • MDN: import
  • MDN: export
  • 2ality: ECMAScript 6 modules: the final syntax
